awd_titl_txt: EM and Pressure Oceanographic Instrumentation Upgrading and Development
awd_abstract_narration: Scripps Institution of Oceanography will upgrade a suite of                     bottom mounted electromagnetic field sensors and bottom                         pressure gauges developed by Jean Filloux and his group.                        These prototype instruments have been used in both                              oceanographic and geophysical investigations.  Their                            modernization will enhance the instruments' reliability for                     future research applications.  The upgrades will incorporate                    advances in electronics and materials which have occurred                       over the past years.  Modern data storage capabilities will                     be added and acoustic releases will be mounted allowing long-                   term deployments for up to 24 months.  Incorporation of new                     ceramic materials and electronics will also increase the                        reliability and stability of the sensors.  The upgrades                         acknowledge the importance of EM measurements as a component                    of future ocean science investigations including the Global                     Geoscience initiatives.

inst.inst_name: University of California-San Diego Scripps Inst of Oceanography
